Name: Geothermal Costs

Caption.String: Pump and Field Gathering System Costs

The number of production wells required is determined on the Geothermal Plant page.  Here you can decide if any of the confirmation wells can be used for production wells, and how many injection wells will be used in the analysis.
(based on the cost of a production well)

Calculated recapitalization cost includes drilling costs, pump costs, and surface equipment.  When the reservoir temperature drops below an allowable minimum, new wells must be drilled and costs acocunted for in the out years of the analysis.
Automatically estimate the plant cost per kW

Tool Tip.String: Determines the number of full-size wells drilled in exploration phase to be used for geothermal field development and production.

Tips.String: Determines the number of full-size wells drilled in exploration phase to be used for geothermal field development and production.

Tool Tip.String: Refers to wells drilled in the exploration phase that have the same dimensions and specifications as a typical production well.

Tips.String: Refers to wells drilled in the exploration phase that have the same dimensions and specifications as a typical production well.

Tool Tip.String: Refers to slim holes, core holes, and temperature gradient wells.

Tips.String: Refers to slim holes, core holes, and temperature gradient wells.

Tool Tip.String: Calculated number of geothermal wells needed to meet the required geothermal flow. Eq.: Total Geothermal Flow Required / Production Well Flow Rate.

Tips.String: Calculated number of geothermal wells needed to meet the required geothermal flow. Eq.: Total Geothermal Flow Required / Production Well Flow Rate.

Tool Tip.String: Refers to the comprehensive costs associated with the exploration, development, and construction of a geothermal power plant. This includes exploration, drilling, stimulation (EGS only), power plant construction, and pumping and field gathering costs.

Tips.String: Refers to the comprehensive costs associated with the exploration, development, and construction of a geothermal power plant. This includes exploration, drilling, stimulation (EGS only), power plant construction, and pumping and field gathering costs.

Tool Tip.String: Refers to general overhead costs incurred during plant construction. This includes engineering, home office, startup, and other activities not directly associated the plant construction. They are calculated as percentages of the direct costs.

Tips.String: Refers to general overhead costs incurred during plant construction. This includes engineering, home office, startup, and other activities not directly associated the plant construction. They are calculated as percentages of the direct costs.

Tool Tip.String: The total installed cost divided by the net power plant capacity.

Tips.String: The total installed cost divided by the net power plant capacity.

Tool Tip.String: This is the sum of the total direct and indirect costs.

Tips.String: This is the sum of the total direct and indirect costs.

Caption.String: The Producer Price Index (PPI) from the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics has annual cost multipliers for several different material categories associated with geothermal plant construction. The base year for the PPI sets the cost multiplier for these categories that are affect the cost calculations on this page.
